macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Hits New Record High on Strong Q3 GDP Data
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.46% to 6,909.79, marking a new all-time closing high after U.S. GDP grew at a 4.3% annual pace in Q3, exceeding expectations of 3.3%. Wall Street closed higher for the fourth straight day amid AI optimism and resilient economic growth.

items.title: Dow Jones Up Slightly to 48,442 Amid Choppy Trading
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 0.16% or 79.73 points to close at 48,442.41, with 18 of 30 components positive despite an intraday low down 108 points. The index rose after mixed economic data including a dip in consumer confidence.

items.title: Nasdaq Composite Climbs 0.57% Led by AI Stocks
items.summary: The Nasdaq rose 0.57% or 133.02 points to 23,561.84, driven by strong gains in AI semiconductors like Marvell Technology up 3.4%. Tech-heavy index benefited from ongoing AI trade momentum.

items.title: Russell 2000 Declines as Small Caps Lag Major Indices
items.summary: The Russell 2000 fell 0.69% or 17.66 points to 2,541.12, underperforming amid broader market gains. Financials sector led S&P 500 sectors up 0.9%, while Consumer Staples slipped 1.1%.

items.title: U.S. Consumer Confidence Mixed with Lower Present Situation Index
items.summary: The Conference Board's Present Situation Index dropped to 116.8 in December from 126.3 in November, while Expectations Index held at 70.7. Data released alongside strong GDP supported market gains despite mixed signals.

items.title: Santa Claus Rally Officially Begins with Positive Historical Odds
items.summary: The 'Santa Claus' rally period starts today, covering the last 5 trading days of the year plus first two of next; historically, S&P 500 rises 76% of the time with 1.3% average gain. Markets eye third straight year of double-digit gains.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin dips after Fed signals sustained high rates; BTC falls ~4%
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped about 3–5% in the past 24 hours after Federal Reserve officials reiterated that rates may remain higher for longer, reducing risk appetite across crypto markets; on-chain activity shows muted inflows to exchanges and steady long-term holder accumulation.

items.title: Ethereum down amid slowing DeFi TVL, Merge-era issuance dynamics draw focus
items.summary: Ether slipped in line with broader market weakness as Total Value Locked (TVL) in DeFi protocols edged lower; analysts pointed to ongoing supply dynamics since The Merge and uncertainty around upcoming protocol-level upgrades as pressure points.

items.title: SEC sues crypto derivatives firm for alleged unregistered securities offerings
items.summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filed suit against a crypto derivatives platform alleging it offered and sold unregistered securities products to U.S. investors, marking the latest enforcement action targeting tokenized and derivatives offerings.

items.title: EU adopts final rules for Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) implementation guidance for stablecoins
items.summary: European regulators published clarifying guidance on MiCA stablecoin rules, outlining operational, reserve and consumer-protection expectations for issuers ahead of stricter supervision and licensing timelines.

items.title: Major exchange announces listing of Solana L2 token after testnet rollout
items.summary: A top centralized exchange revealed it will list the native token of a prominent Solana layer-2 rollup following successful testnet performance, boosting the token's price and signaling growing institutional interest in Solana scaling solutions.

items.title: Stablecoin issuer expands fiat reserve audits after regulatory scrutiny
items.summary: A major US-dollar stablecoin issuer said it will increase frequency and transparency of attestation reports and add full reserve audits by a Big Four firm, responding to recent regulatory pressure and market trust concerns.

items.title: Layer-1 blockchain announces mainnet upgrade to improve smart-contract throughput
items.summary: A well-known layer-1 network deployed a scheduled mainnet upgrade today that introduces parallel transaction execution and gas-efficiency improvements, with early metrics showing lower fees and reduced transaction confirmation times.

items.title: Whale accumulation spikes for altcoin after roadmap reveal; price surges 20%
items.summary: On-chain analytics flagged a large accumulation by several wallets in a mid-cap altcoin following the release of a new product roadmap and partnership announcements, triggering a ~20% rally within 24 hours.

items.title: Crypto lending protocol pauses withdrawals after governance bug disclosed
items.summary: A decentralized lending platform temporarily paused withdrawals and initiated an emergency governance vote after developers discovered a vulnerability in its collateral-checking logic; auditors are reviewing a proposed patch.

items.title: Singapore regulator fines exchange for AML lapses in cross-border crypto flows
items.summary: The Monetary Authority of Singapore issued a fine to a regional exchange for deficiencies in anti-money-laundering controls related to cross-border crypto transactions, emphasizing tighter supervision of regional fiat-crypto gateways.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Galatek raises $30M Series A to scale AI automation in life sciences and semiconductors
items.summary: Galatek announced a $30 million Series A to expand its AI-driven automation platform for laboratory and semiconductor workflows, targeting scaling of robotic automation and ML-driven process optimization in life sciences and chip manufacturing.

items.title: Mecalux–MIT collaboration highlights GenAI and reinforcement learning for logistics
items.summary: Mecalux published a piece describing advances and plans for using generative AI and reinforcement learning in warehouse optimisation, autonomous order distribution, and AMR (autonomous mobile robot) coordination based on a joint research effort with MIT.

items.title: Agentic AI framed as key enabler for ‘smart factories’ in manufacturing coverage
items.summary: Industry analysis argues agentic AI — systems that plan and act autonomously across tasks — is accelerating smart factory capabilities, enabling dynamic scheduling, predictive maintenance, and end-to-end process automation in manufacturing.

items.title: AI power tools for developers: terminal-focused assistants and integrations
items.summary: Infoworld reviews emerging AI-powered developer tools that integrate LLMs into the command line and REPL workflows, highlighting utilities that run tests, integrate with git, and provide project-aware assistance to streamline coding and ops tasks.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Receives New Patch Notes Version 1.031
items.summary: Bandai Namco released the latest patch notes for Elden Ring Nightreign on Christmas Eve, sparking discussions among players on character builds, MMR systems, and impressive gameplay runs like double balancer wylder strategies.

items.title: SpongeBob SquarePants: Titans of the Tide Launches Tidal Season Pass with Search for SquarePants Costumes
items.summary: THQ Nordic announced the Tidal Season Pass for SpongeBob SquarePants: Titans of the Tide, featuring exclusive DLC including the Search for SquarePants Costume Pack, Plankton's Portal Challenge, and more content inspired by the new SpongeBob movie, available now on multiple platforms.

items.title: Games Industry News Roundup for December 23rd, 2025
items.summary: Goonhammer published a roundup of games industry news on December 23rd, covering recent developments alongside updates like Middle Earth Strategy Battle Game's new edition review.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Stanford Researchers Unveil Breakthrough 3D Chip for Faster Computing
items.summary: Stanford University researchers have developed a novel 3D computer chip that stacks memory and computing elements vertically, outperforming comparable 2D chips by four times and promising up to 12-fold improvements on real workloads. The prototype was manufactured in a U.S. foundry, marking a step toward scalable production.

items.title: Quantum Computing Emerges as Next Big Stock Market Opportunity with Undervalued Players
items.summary: Quantum computing is gaining traction as the stock market's next major tech sector, with advancements from DARPA evaluations and companies like IonQ and Honeywell's Quantinuum highlighted for their potential despite recent stock corrections. Experts warn of 'Q-Day' when quantum tech could break classical cryptography, prompting U.S. government focus.
